poem:
Title: "Specter of Democracy"

Sunak, in the shadowed hall,
Promises traded, echoes of power
In the nimbus of No. 10.
Labour waits in the wings,
Under the thwarted populace's gaze,
In constant ballet with the public will.
Rwanda bill beguilement,
A delicate dance on a political wire;
Yet in the theatre of politics,
Is the script ever truly ours?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
